content.body: I don't want "one invariant at a time" as an end in itself, I want test file **maintainability** (which has **comprehensibility** as a necessary but not sufficient condition) and **failure clarity**. test/built-ins/Iterator/zip/basic.js is weak on both, while test/built-ins/Iterator/zip/basic-iterator-*.js are good on the former but weak on the latter.

content.body: I agree that having better messages for the assertions would be valuable, but that's unrelated to how the tests are split and I don't think changing the split changes much about failure clarity
it's not unrelated, because as noted there's a limit of one failed assertion per file. So which files fail is itself a relevant signal.
I think with an appropriate message there's basically no marginal value in also having high granularity with the file names.
